conclusion: Determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, C, and D.
Point A is located at the top left corner.
Liquid from point A flows downward and encounters the first baffle (orange).
The orange baffle directs the liquid towards the right.
Liquid continues moving right and encounters the next baffle (gray).
The gray baffle directs the liquid downwards.
Liquid from point A flows into container F.
Point B is located near the top center-left.
Liquid from point B flows downward and encounters the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid towards the right.
Liquid continues moving right and encounters the gray baffle.
The gray baffle directs the liquid downwards.
Liquid from point B flows into container F.
Point C is located near the top center-right.
Liquid from point C flows downward and encounters the blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the liquid towards the left.
Liquid continues moving left and encounters the teal baffle.
The teal baffle directs the liquid downwards.
Liquid from point C flows into container E.
Point D is located at the top right corner.
Liquid from point D flows downward and encounters the blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the liquid towards the left.
Liquid continues moving left and encounters the teal baffle.
The teal baffle directs the liquid downwards.
Liquid from point D flows into container E.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container F.
